TopicTitle: Ksp flashes not responding and window flashes every time I click

Articles.Content: Latest version of ksp, i'v tried uninstalling and reinstalling plenty of times. In the building menu I can't click anything and if I does the window spazzes out and then it'll minimize itself and I can't reopen it and then have to close and restart. Not sure what went wrong. Does it have something to do with my dual monitors?

Hi sundr0p, can you test it on a single monitor just to be sure?

It may be a driver issue, if you could, please run dxdiag to get a hardware report, and upload it and the output_log.txt from KSP_Data to a file share or paste site.

Single monitor did exactly the same thing

ksp.log - http://pastebin.com/bD9AzfmR

dxdiag - http://pastebin.com/BGWRhRh9

output log - http://www./view/mjoovpqddlo6jw4/output_log.txt

Okay, looks like the fallback shader is on, it's rubbish so I recommend not using it.

[LOG 17:06:30.369] PQS - Graphics shader in fallback mode

And the graphics driver does look a little old, your dxdiag says you have 34752, current is 35891.

Other than that it looks fine, so maybe try the new driver and see how it goes, don't forget to reboot!

Okay, looks like the fallback shader is on, it's rubbish so I recommend not using it.

And the graphics driver does look a little old, your dxdiag says you have 34752, current is 35891.

Other than that it looks fine, so maybe try the new driver and see how it goes, don't forget to reboot!

Hate to say it but that didn't work. it seems to start up easier but as soon as i get into the assembly building and I try to click on anything, the game freezes, a loading circle comes up, the window flashes and then it minimizes itself and wont come back up.

Can you screenshot your taskmanager processes list, maybe something is conflicting.

I know that KSP is really sensitive to overclocking, and something called PrecisionX is making it crash.

Here's everything on my process list. After that its just a few windows processes.

http://imgur.com/a/h8rCY
Not seeing anything obvious, are you overclocking at all ?
Not at all. I can make a video of whats happening if that would help?
Maybe it would, as this doesn't sound like something I have seen before, and maybe someone else has seen it.

I went ahead and uninstalled vmware, and then had to drop the resolution to 1280/720 windowed, and now its playable. but now every time I click one certain things the game bumps or flashes really quick.

Edited November 10, 2015 by sundr0p

Okay, yeah I have never seen that, that is very strange indeed :/

Hopefully someone here has seen it.
the only thing I can think of it being is my graphics card. I sure hope that's not it. anyways thank you and I sure hope someone can help.
Yeah I have that same problem 2 can you help me fix it.

Hi @Kevingomez28, what other software are you running when you play KSP?

KSP doesn't do this, so something else is making KSP do this.
